name: market for inorganic phosphorus fertiliser, as P2O5 | inorganic phosphorus fertiliser, as P2O5 | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/23706/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This is a generic market that provides 'inorganic phosphorus fertiliser, as P2O5' for a strictly agricultural use as fertiliser. The market combines (consumption mix) various inorganic sources for the nutrient provided for the given geography. Data for the consumption of this nutrient originate from the International Fertiliser Association.;References: Consumption of fertilisers, accessed on 5th of May 2020 at: https://www.ifastat.org/;No transport or losses have been considered for the generic product supplied in this market, as the transport modelled in the upstream niche markets for the more specific products do already account it.;Fertilisers are substances that furnish essential nutrients for plant growth, thereby improving the yield and in some cases the quality of plant products. 'Inorganic phosphorus fertiliser, as P2O5' is a fertiliser with a mineral origin that is supplying the nutrient of Phosphorus to the plants. The product represents an equivalent form of Phosphorus that is present in the fertiliser and is expressed as a mass of Phosphorus pentoxide (P2O5). 'Inorganic phosphorus fertiliser, as P2O5'  can  originate from various substances that are synthesised using fossil resources. Those substances can be, phosphoric acid, beneficiated phosphate rock etc, while the fossil resources can be phosphate rock.;The composition of this market is constracted with national consumption data from the International Fertilizer Association. The market represents 100% of the 'inorganic phosphorus fertiliser, as P2O5' that is consumed in Bangladesh.  In the event that the market is not 100% representative, that data have been normalised based on the available fertilisers in the database. 

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce ''inorganic phosphorus fertiliser, as P2O5'' with the product ready for transportation.

This activity ends with the supply of 1 kg of ''inorganic phosphorus fertiliser, as P2O5'' to the consumers of this product within the geography of Bangladesh.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/016:Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities/0161:Support activities for crop production

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This activity delivers the product of ''inorganic phosphorus fertiliser, as P2O5'' within the geography of Bangladesh.

flow.name: inorganic phosphorus fertiliser, as P2O5
flow.category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/016:Support activities to agriculture and post-harvest crop activities/0161:Support activities for crop production

exchanges.description: The composition of this market is constracted with national consumption data from the International Fertilizer Association. The market represents 100% of the 'inorganic phosphorus fertiliser, as P2O5' that is consumed in this geography. In the event that the market is not 100% representative, that data have been normalised based on the available fertilisers in the database. 'triple superphosphate'  participates to the composition of 'market for inorganic phosphorus fertiliser, as P2O5' in Bangladesh with a normalised contribution of circa 49.68%.
